channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WI

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found in unload leaking. DescribePack: the package was found leaking. One bottle inside package was crushed. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Once package was found leaking it was placed in hazmat bag and placed in a drum and moved to the hazmat cage.

item.title: Report X-2024010714
item.description:

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-02
  • City: MADISON
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: found the box in the hazmat cage . DescribePack: once inspected, found that the plastic container holding a liquid has a good-sized tear in the plastic under the handle. some has leaked out, which the box has absorbed. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: all was put into the hazmat cage in a plastic lined black tote.

item.title: Report E-2024020015
item.description:
Report E-2024020015

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-05T15:13:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-04
  • City: VIROQUA
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG Energy, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC driver opened a valve on the trailer prior to having the delivery hose connected to the storage tank. This allowed approximately 11 gallons of diesel fuel to be released. Hepaco Environmental responded and handled the remediation.

item.title: Report E-2024010518
item.description:
Report E-2024010518

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-02T15:12:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-29
  • City: TOMAH
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: As a result of a forklift puncture, a 55-steel drum containing Methanol was punctured. This resulted in 15-gallons of Methanol released onto a concrete, dock floor affecting a 10'x10' area. A Contractor was called to clean-up the spill. The damaged drum was over-packed into a 95DF along with absorbent pads and booms. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were impacted.
